2 import cv2
3 import numpy as np

5 import rospy

7 # Services
8 from niryo_robot_msgs.srv import SetBool, SetBoolRequest, SetString, SetStringRequest
9 from niryo_robot_vision.srv import (ActivateDebugTopics,
10  DebugColorDetection,
11  DebugColorDetectionRequest,
12  DebugMarkers,
13  DebugMarkersRequest,

16  ObjDetectionResponse,

21 # Messages
22 from sensor_msgs.msg import CompressedImage, CameraInfo
23 from std_msgs.msg import Bool
24 from niryo_robot_msgs.msg import CommandStatus, ObjectPose
25 from niryo_robot_vision.msg import ActiveDebugTopics, ImageParameters
26 
27 # Packages
28 from niryo_robot_utils import sentry_init
29 from niryo_robot_vision.business.enums import ObjectShape, ObjectColor
30 from niryo_robot_vision.business import image_processing, markers, colors
31 from niryo_robot_vision.implem.abstract_stream import AbstractStream
32 from niryo_robot_vision.implem import built_in_camera, client_stream
33 
34 
35 class VisionNode:
36 
37  def __init__(self):
38 
39  self.__camera_port = rospy.get_param('~camera_port')
40  self.__stream_compression_quality = rospy.get_param('~stream_compression_quality')
41  self.__debug_compression_quality = rospy.get_param('~debug_compression_quality')
42 
43  camera_intrinsics = rospy.get_param('~cam_intrinsics')
44  frame_rate = rospy.get_param('~frame_rate')
45 
46  camera_config = built_in_camera.CameraConfig(mtx=np.array(camera_intrinsics['mtx']),
47  dist=np.array(camera_intrinsics['dist']),
48  flip=rospy.get_param('~flip_img'),
49  width_img=camera_intrinsics['width_img'],
50  height_img=camera_intrinsics['height_img'],
51  acquisition_rate=frame_rate)
52  self.__webcam_stream = built_in_camera.Stream(
53  camera_index=self.__camera_port,
54  config=camera_config,
55  publish_frame_cb=self.__publish_compressed_stream,
56  )
57  self.__client_stream = client_stream.Stream(
58  rospy.get_param('~client_stream_topic'),
59  publish_frame_cb=self.__publish_compressed_stream,
60  )
61 
62  self.__source = 'webcam'
63  if self.__webcam_stream.is_available:
64  self.__webcam_stream.start()
65 
66  self.__camera_intrinsics_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~camera_intrinsics', CameraInfo, latch=True, queue_size=1)
67  self.__camera_intrinsics_publisher.publish(camera_config.to_ros_camera_info())
68 
69  # == Ros interface == #
70 
71  # Main stream
72  self.__compressed_stream_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~compressed_video_stream', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
73  self.__stream_active_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~video_stream_is_active', Bool, queue_size=2)
74 
75  # Stream editing
76  rospy.Service('~start_stop_video_streaming', SetBool, self.__callback_start_stop)
77  rospy.Service('~set_source', SetString, self.__callback_set_source)
78  rospy.Service('~set_saturation', SetImageParameter, self.__callback_set_saturation)
79  rospy.Service('~set_brightness', SetImageParameter, self.__callback_set_brightness)
80  rospy.Service('~set_contrast', SetImageParameter, self.__callback_set_contrast)
81  self.__stream_parameters_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~video_stream_parameters',
82  ImageParameters,
83  queue_size=2,
84  latch=True)
85 
86  # Debug features
87  self.__red_channel_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~debug/red_channel', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
88  self.__green_channel_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~debug/green_channel', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
89  self.__blue_channel_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~debug/blue_channel', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
90  self.__any_channel_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~debug/any_channel', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
91  self.__markers_publisher = rospy.Publisher('~debug/markers', CompressedImage, queue_size=1)
92  self.__active_debug_topics = rospy.Publisher('~debug/active_topics',
93  ActiveDebugTopics,
94  queue_size=1,
95  latch=True)
96  # dict to keep track of what debug topics are activated, and what method to call to get the image
97  self.__activated_debug_publishers = {
98  self.__red_channel_publisher: {
99  'is_active': False,
100  'publish_method': lambda: self.__get_image_channel_as_msg(ObjectColor.RED),
101  },
102  self.__green_channel_publisher: {
103  'is_active': False,
104  'publish_method': lambda: self.__get_image_channel_as_msg(ObjectColor.GREEN),
105  },
106  self.__blue_channel_publisher: {
107  'is_active': False,
108  'publish_method': lambda: self.__get_image_channel_as_msg(ObjectColor.BLUE),
109  },
110  self.__any_channel_publisher: {
111  'is_active': False,
112  'publish_method': lambda: self.__get_image_channel_as_msg(ObjectColor.ANY),
113  },
114  self.__markers_publisher: {
115  'is_active': False,
116  'publish_method': lambda: self.__get_image_w_markers_as_msg()[1],
117  },
118  }
119  rospy.Service('~debug_markers', DebugMarkers, self.__callback_debug_markers)
120  rospy.Service('~debug_colors', DebugColorDetection, self.__callback_debug_color)
121  rospy.Service('~debug/activate', ActivateDebugTopics, self.__callback_activate_debug)
122 
123  # Object detection
124  rospy.Service('~obj_detection_rel', ObjDetection, self.__callback_get_obj_relative_pose)
125 
126  rospy.Timer(rospy.Duration(1.0 / rospy.get_param('~is_active_rate')), self.__publish_is_active)
127  rospy.Timer(rospy.Duration(1.0 / frame_rate), self.__publish_debug_topics_callback)
128 
129  # Set a bool to mentioned this node is initialized
130  rospy.set_param('~initialized', True)
131 
132  rospy.loginfo('Vision Node - Initialized')
133 
134  @property
135  def __stream(self) -> AbstractStream:
136  """
137  Return the selected stream.
138  :return:
139  """
140  return {
141  'webcam': self.__webcam_stream,
142  'client': self.__client_stream,
143  }[self.__source]
144 
145  # - CALLBACK
146  def __callback_get_obj_relative_pose(self, req: ObjDetectionRequest):
147  """
148  Callback to get the relative pose of an object detected in the image.
149  :param req: The request containing the object color and type
150  :return: The response containing the object relative x, y and yaw and its shape and color
151  """
152  try:
153  found_object = image_processing.detect_object(self.__stream.get_image(),
154  ObjectColor[req.obj_color],
155  ObjectShape[req.obj_type],
156  req.workspace_ratio)
157  except image_processing.MarkersNotFoundError:
158  return CommandStatus.MARKERS_NOT_FOUND, None, None, None, None
159  except image_processing.NoShapeFoundError:
160  return CommandStatus.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND, None, None, None, None
161 
162  return ObjDetectionResponse(
163  status=CommandStatus.SUCCESS,
164  obj_pose=ObjectPose(x=found_object.x, y=found_object.y, yaw=found_object.yaw),
165  obj_type=found_object.shape.name,
166  obj_color=found_object.color.name,
167  )
168 
169  def __callback_debug_markers(self, _: DebugMarkersRequest):
170  """
171  Callback to get the image with the markers drawn on it.
172  :param _: The request
173  :return: The response containing the image
174  """
175  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Successfully got debug markers', *self.__get_image_w_markers_as_msg()
176 
177  def __callback_debug_color(self, req: DebugColorDetectionRequest):
178  """
179  Callback to get the image with the specified color channel.
180  :param req: The request containing the color channel
181  :return: The response containing the image
182  """
183  try:
184  color = ObjectColor[req.color]
185  except image_processing.NoShapeFoundError:
186  return CommandStatus.FAILURE, f'Invalid color. Possible values are {[c.name for c in ObjectColor]}', None
187  try:
188  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Successfully got debug colors', self.__get_image_channel_as_msg(color)
189  except Exception as e:
190  return CommandStatus.FAILURE, f'Failed to get debug colors: {e}', None
191 
192  def __callback_activate_debug(self, req: ActivateDebugTopicsRequest):
193  self.__activated_debug_publishers[self.__red_channel_publisher]['is_active'] = req.topics.red_channel
194  self.__activated_debug_publishers[self.__green_channel_publisher]['is_active'] = req.topics.green_channel
195  self.__activated_debug_publishers[self.__blue_channel_publisher]['is_active'] = req.topics.blue_channel
196  self.__activated_debug_publishers[self.__any_channel_publisher]['is_active'] = req.topics.any_channel
197  self.__activated_debug_publishers[self.__markers_publisher]['is_active'] = req.topics.markers
198 
199  self.__active_debug_topics.publish(req.topics)
200  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Successfully updated the debug topics'
201 
202  def __callback_start_stop(self, req: SetBoolRequest):
203  """
204  Callback to start or stop the video stream.
205  :param req: The request containing the desired state
206  :return: The response indicating success or failure
207  """
208  if req.value is True:
209  if not self.__stream.is_available:
210  return CommandStatus.FAILURE, 'Stream is not available.'
211 
212  try:
213  self.__stream.start()
214  except RuntimeError:
215  return True, 'Stream already started'
216  self.__stream_active_publisher.publish(Bool(data=True))
217  return True, 'Video stream started'
218  else:
219  try:
220  self.__stream.stop()
221  except RuntimeError:
222  return True, 'Stream already stopped'
223  self.__stream_active_publisher.publish(Bool(data=False))
224  return True, 'Video stream stopped'
225 
226  def __callback_set_source(self, req: SetStringRequest):
227  if req.value not in ['webcam', 'client']:
228  return CommandStatus.FAILURE, 'Invalid source. Possible values are [webcam, client]'
229 
230  try:
231  self.__stream.stop()
232  except RuntimeError:
233  pass
234 
235  self.__source = req.value
236  self.__stream.start()
237 
238  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, f'Source set successfully set to {req.value}'
239 
240  def __callback_set_saturation(self, req: SetImageParameterRequest):
241  """
242  Callback to set the saturation of the image stream.
243  :param req: The request containing the saturation factor
244  :return: The response indicating success or failure
245  """
246  self.__stream.saturation = req.factor
247  self.__stream_parameters_publisher.publish(
248  ImageParameters(brightness_factor=self.__stream.brightness,
249  contrast_factor=self.__stream.contrast,
250  saturation_factor=self.__stream.saturation))
251  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Saturation set successfully'
252 
253  def __callback_set_brightness(self, req: SetImageParameterRequest):
254  """
255  Callback to set the brightness of the image stream.
256  :param req: The request containing the brightness factor
257  :return: The response indicating success or failure
258  """
259  self.__stream.brightness = req.factor
260  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Brightness set successfully'
261 
262  def __callback_set_contrast(self, req: SetImageParameterRequest):
263  """
264  Callback to set the contrast of the image stream.
265  :param req: The request containing the contrast factor
266  :return: The response indicating success or failure
267  """
268  self.__stream.contrast = req.factor
269  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, 'Contrast set successfully'
270 
271  def __publish_is_active(self, _: rospy.timer.TimerEvent):
272  """
273  Publish the is_active parameter.
274  :param _: The timer event
275  """
276  self.__stream_active_publisher.publish(Bool(data=self.__stream.is_active))
277 
278  def __publish_compressed_stream(self, frame: np.ndarray):
279  """
280  Publish the compressed image stream. This callback is called by the stream when a new frame is available.
281  :param frame: The frame to publish
282  :type frame: numpy.ndarray
283  """
284  self.__compressed_stream_publisher.publish(self.__generate_msg_from_frame(frame))
285 
286  def __publish_debug_topics_callback(self, _: rospy.timer.TimerEvent):
287  """
288  Publish the debug topics. To reduce the load on the CPU, we only publish (and thus computing the images) on the
289  debug topics if there is at least one subscriber.
290  :param _: The timer event
291  """
292  for publisher, topic_info in self.__activated_debug_publishers.items():
293  if not topic_info['is_active']:
294  continue
295  try:
296  publisher.publish(topic_info['publish_method']())
297  except Exception as e:
298  rospy.logerr(f'Failed to publish debug topic {publisher.resolved_name}: {e}')
299 
300  def __generate_msg_from_frame(self, frame, compression_quality: float = None) -> CompressedImage:
301  """
302  Generate a CompressedImage message from a frame. It encodes the image in JPEG format.
303  :param frame: The frame to compress
304  :param compression_quality: The compression quality to use. If None, use the classical stream value.
305  The value must be between 0 and 100.
306  :return: The CompressedImage message
307  """
308  if compression_quality is None:
309  compression_quality = self.__stream_compression_quality
310 
311  _, encoded_img = cv2.imencode('.jpg', frame, [int(cv2.IMWRITE_JPEG_QUALITY), compression_quality])
312  msg = CompressedImage()
313  msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
314  msg.format = 'jpg'
315  msg.data = encoded_img.tobytes()
316  return msg
317 
318  def __get_image_channel_as_msg(self, color: ObjectColor) -> CompressedImage:
319  """
320  Get the image with the specified color channel and return it as a CompressedImage message.
321  :param color: The color channel to get
322  :return: The CompressedImage message
323  """
324  return self.__generate_msg_from_frame(
325  colors.filter_channel(self.__stream.get_image(), color),
326  compression_quality=self.__debug_compression_quality,
327  )
328 
329  def __get_image_w_markers_as_msg(self) -> (bool, CompressedImage):
330  """
331  Get the image with the markers drawn on it and return it as a CompressedImage message.
332  :return: A tuple containing a boolean indicating if the markers were found and the CompressedImage message
333  """
334  found, frame = markers.draw_markers(self.__stream.get_image())
335  return found, self.__generate_msg_from_frame(
336  frame,
337  compression_quality=self.__debug_compression_quality,
338  )
339 
340 
341 if __name__ == '__main__':
342  sentry_init()
343 
344  rospy.init_node('niryo_robot_vision', anonymous=False, log_level=rospy.INFO)
345 
346  try:
347  vision_node = VisionNode()
348  rospy.spin()
349  except rospy.ROSInterruptException:
350  pass
